title: How to Make a Hangi

steps.headline: Make a suitable container.
steps.description: You can buy a secondhand stainless steel beer keg from any scrap steelyard, garage sale or newspaper advert. A 9 gallon keg is a good size to start with. You can get 4 chickens and vegetables into it with ease.

steps.headline: Cut the top off with a cut off grinder 6 inches (15.2 cm) from the top.
steps.description: Weld a 1 inch (2.5 cm) x 1/8th strap around the edge of the top to make a lip so that the top fits snug over the main part of the keg.

steps.headline: Weld several ⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) stainless steel rods 6 inches (15.2 cm) inside up from the bottom to make a grid for the meat to sit on.
Put the keg on 4 bricks and put a gas ring underneath attached to your BBQ bottle for heating.
Put about 2 inches (5.1 cm) of volcanic stones in the bottom of the keg, under the grill you welded in, with 2 liters of water over it.
Wrap chickens, leg of pork, lamb, or pieces in cheesecloth, mutton cloth or clean cotton and place inside on the grill you have welded inside.
Place banana leaves over the top of the meats.
Peel and prepare carrots, potatoes, celery, onions, pumpkin.
steps.description: Place them in wire baskets made out of chicken wire, or cheesecloth bags will do, on top of the meats. You can even use oven bags if you want.

steps.headline: Fit the lid and light the gas ring.
steps.description: Cook for 4 hours. Every 1/2 hour, lift the lid and make sure that it is still steaming. If it isn't steaming, add some water.

text: Make a suitable container. You can buy a secondhand stainless steel beer keg from any scrap steelyard, garage sale or newspaper advert. A 9 gallon keg is a good size to start with. You can get 4 chickens and vegetables into it with ease. Cut the top off with a cut off grinder 6 inches (15.2 cm) from the top. Weld a 1 inch (2.5 cm) x 1/8th strap around the edge of the top to make a lip so that the top fits snug over the main part of the keg. Weld several ⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) stainless steel rods 6 inches (15.2 cm) inside up from the bottom to make a grid for the meat to sit on. Now you have Hangi! Put the keg on 4 bricks and put a gas ring underneath attached to your BBQ bottle for heating.  Put about 2 inches (5.1 cm) of volcanic stones in the bottom of the keg, under the grill you welded in, with 2 liters of water over it.  Wrap chickens, leg of pork, lamb, or pieces in cheesecloth, mutton cloth or clean cotton and place inside on the grill you have welded inside.  Place banana leaves over the top of the meats.  Peel and prepare carrots, potatoes, celery, onions, pumpkin. Place them in wire baskets made out of chicken wire, or cheesecloth bags will do, on top of the meats. You can even use oven bags if you want. Fit the lid and light the gas ring. Cook for 4 hours. Every 1/2 hour, lift the lid and make sure that it is still steaming. If it isn't steaming, add some water.
